etymology.description: Represents fruits hanging on a tree -> fruit
etymology.interpretation: 果(果) (guǒ, 'fruit') visually depicts fruit on a tree, aligning with its meaning as a representation of fruits hanging from branches. This intuitive imagery is related to how the character 栗(栗) (lì, 'chestnut') and 某(某) (mǒu, 'certain') depict similar objects, though other uses like 喿 do not apply here.

examples.chinese: 她把最甜的果挑出来(她把最甜的果挑出來)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ zuì tián de guǒ tiāo chūlái.
examples.english: She picked out the sweetest fruit.

examples.chinese: 秋天到了(秋天到了)，树上挂满了红艳艳的果(樹上掛滿了紅艷艷的果)。
examples.pinyin: Qiūtiān dào le, shù shàng guà mǎn le hóng yàn yàn de guǒ.
examples.english: Autumn arrived, and the trees were laden with brilliantly red fruits.
